item.description:
There is A LOT of social media activity in and around the life sciences.

This will be an open forum where we can trade stories and information about how people in biotechnology are effectively using social media to advance their work.

If you're interested in biotechnology (and if you're reading this we presume that you are) then you also should be interested in how online and social media tools are making it easier to get, share and comment on research, network with others, and work with organizations and groups that can help you with everything from clinical trials to marketing and sales.

Jerry Johnson will lead the discussion and share some presentations on the subject that he's collected over the past several months. Bring your best web sites, blogs, social networks, twitter feeds, etc. and we'll trade tips and information.
item.name: Open Forum - Social Media for Biotech and Life Sciences
